question.name: Question 1
question.text: Which of the following best describes actual steps in the process when you call the Ethics & Compliance HelpLine with a concern or issue?
question.correctans: a. You will be asked to describe your concern/issue and can choose whether to remain anonymous.
question.choices: a. You will be asked to describe your concern/issue and can choose whether to remain anonymous.|b. In reporting a concern, you will be advised that you cannot remain anonymous. |c. You will immediately be given a case number and directed to a policy.|d. The Ethics & Investigations team will immediately schedule an in-person meeting between you and all others involved to work through the issue/concern.

question.name: Question 1
question.text: Sean is a senior manager leading a growing project. Maria is a senior associate who was recently added to his expanding team. Sean and Maria are from the same home town and had previously dated. Working together has prompted a new close personal relationship. According to the firm's Relationship Policy, what action is most essential for their personal relationship to continue?
question.correctans: d. They must inform the engagement leader and HR and end their reporting relationship.
question.choices: a. They must tell everyone on the engagement about their close personal relationship.|b. The couple must continue to be discreet as they begin to date again and keep their relationship outside of the workplace.|c. Sean and Maria must ensure that there are no perceptions of favoritism or objectivity.|d. They must inform the engagement leader and HR and end their reporting relationship.

question.name: Question 1
question.text: What resource provides specific guidance for:\r\u2022 collecting and using only the minimum amount of information necessary for your work, \r\u2022 securing information and devices when not in use, and \r\u2022 using only firm-managed equipment and email accounts for work-related matters?\r
question.choices: a. Global Code of Conduct|b. US Independence Policy|c. Information Protection Principles|d. Insider Trading Policy

question.name: Question 1
question.text: Which of the following are common tactics used by unauthorized individuals, social engineers, to attempt to obtain information?\rI. \u201CFollowing\u201D others on social media sites\rII. Eavesdropping on conversations\rIII. Making threatening comments on blog postings\rIV. Making fraudulent information requests
question.choices: a. I and II only|b. II and IV only|c. III and IV only|d. I and III only

question.name: Question 1
question.text: Which of the following entities under anti-corruption laws and regulations would be considered a government client?
question.choices: a. Harvard University|b. The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation|c. American Association of Retired Persons (AARP)|d. The World Bank

question.name: Question 1
question.text: John Smith is interested in developing a client relationship with ABC Hospital Group in China. John would like to take the CEO of the ABC Hospital Group out to lunch to discuss PwC's capabilities. John knows that ABC Hospital Group is controlled by the Chinese government, and therefore the CEO is considered a Chinese government official. In preparation for the lunch meeting, what should John do to make sure that he adheres to the appropriate laws and regulations on interacting with foreign government officials?
question.correctans: d. John should consult with the Ethics and Compliance HelpLine.
question.choices: a. If the lunch does not exceed US$100, John does not need to do anything.|b. If the CEO of ABC Hospital Group offers to pay for lunch, John does not need to do anything.|c. John cannot take the CEO of ABC Hospital Group to lunch because it is against firm anti-corruption policies to interact with any government official.|d. John should consult with the Ethics and Compliance HelpLine.

question.name: Question 1
question.text: PwC is pulling together a learning event for clients. Attendees will get lunch and will get CPE credits. You are interested in inviting your client who is an employee of a state run university. What considerations should you make before inviting your client to attend the learning event?
question.correctans: a. Since your client is a government employee, attendance at this event may be prohibited by anti-corruption laws.
question.choices: a. Since your client is a government employee, attendance at this event may be prohibited by anti-corruption laws.|b. Even though your client is a government employee, since the event is just a learning event and CPE's will be awarded, anti-corruption laws do not apply.|c. Since PwC does not charge clients for attending learning events, anti-corruption laws do not apply.|d. Since CPE credits have a fair market value your client can attend the event but they may not be able to receive the CPE credits.
